alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 14 at 3:20AM EDT until March 15 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TODAY INTO WEDNESDAY... .Rapidly strengthening low pressure approaches southern New England this morning, and remains in the Gulf of Maine into tomorrow. Snow continues overspreading the area during the morning hours today. Greatest snowfall will likely fall at higher terrain across the Monadnocks, Sunapee, the Ossippees, and White Mountains. At lower elevations, heavy and wet snow is expected, likely causing scattered power outages today and tonight. Gusty northeast to north winds of 40 to 55 mph this afternoon and evening could accentuate the power outage risk this afternoon. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches, locally higher amounts across the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Maine, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin, and Northern Oxford Counties. In New Hampshire, Northern Coos and Southern Coos Counties. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
